title: King's coronation oil will be animal-cruelty free
description: A new version of sacred oil to be used at the King's coronation has been consecrated in Jerusalem.

title: Matt Hancock's reaction to photo of kiss with aide revealed in text leak
description: The former health secretary asked if another minister could emphasise that "no rules have been broken", leaked messages show.

title: Super League: St Helens 24-25 Leeds Rhinos - Blake Austin drop-goal seals shock win
description: Leeds Rhinos stun champions St Helens, who have Konrad Hurrell sent off, with a late drop-goal winner from Blake Austin.

title: Premiership: Bristol Bears 62-8 Northampton Saints - Bears claim record win
description: Bristol claim their biggest Premiership win as they thrash a depleted Northampton 62-8 at Ashton Gate.

title: Hull City 2-0 West Brom: Benjamin Tetteh gets his first Tigers goal as they beat Baggies
description: Benjamin Tetteh scores his first goal for Hull City as the Tigers beat Championship play-off hopefuls West Bromwich Albion.

title: Why Alex Murdaugh was spared the death penalty
description: People have been sentenced to death for less than this double murder, the judge told the convicted killer.

title: Joe Biden had cancerous skin lesion removed, White House says
description: The US president's doctor says all cancerous tissue was successfully removed in February.

title: Dover: Three lifeboats launched after fire breaks out on ferry
description: The Isle of Innisfree was sailing to France when fire broke out in its engine room, Irish Ferries says.

title: European Indoor Championships: Neil Gourley wins 1500m silver as Great Britain claim three medals
description: Britain's Neil Gourley claims men's 1500m silver at the European Indoor Championships, with team-mates Daryll Neita and Melissa Courtney-Bryant both winning bronze medals.

title: Scottish teachers call off strikes after pay offer
description: Unions suspend further strike action while members are consulted on an improved pay deal.

title: European Indoor Championships: Nafissatou Thiam and Adrianna Sulek set two pentathlon world records
description: Watch as Adrianna Sulek sets a new pentathlon world record with a brilliant 800m run only to see Nafissatou Thiam break it and win gold when she crosses the line six seconds later at the European Indoor Championships.

title: David Beckham: All 18 Premier League Beckham free-kick goals as James Ward-Prowse nears record
description: BBC Sport looks back at all 18 of David Beckham's goals from free kicks in the Premier League as Southampton's James Ward-Prowse looks to equal his record.

title: Airlines sue Dutch government over flight cuts
description: The government cited noise pollution and climate concerns in its decision to restrict flights.

title: Dubai Tennis Championship: Russian Andrey Rublev calls for peace after reaching final
description: Russian tennis player Andrey Rublev reiterates his call for peace in the war in Ukraine after reaching the Dubai Tennis Championship final.

title: David Carrick: Rapist will not have sentence reviewed
description: The Solicitor General says he is satisfied the ex-Met officer's jail term is not unduly lenient.

title: Horizon: Scientists warn Sunak on EU research programme
description: PM Rishi Sunak is warned not to go back on his pledge to re-join the EU's science research programme.

title: Two unions suspend ambulance strikes in England as talks reopen
description: Unison and GMB suspend strike in England but action from Unite members to go ahead as planned on Monday.

title: Welsh Ambulance strikes: Unions call off Monday's action
description: The GMB and Unite unions have paused Monday's action after "significant" talks with ministers.

title: Bahrain Grand Prix: Fernando Alonso edges out Red Bulls in second practice

title: 'Leaning tower of Rotherhithe' sells for £1.5m

title: Five key findings from Boris Johnson inquiry update
description: Cross-party committee of MPs release initial findings into whether Boris Johnson misled Parliament.

title: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe says he has not sought assurances on club ownership

title: Former PM Liz Truss: 'I didn't do everything perfectly'

title: Budget 2023: What is it and when will it happen?

title: Asbjorn Halvorsen and Otto Harder - the story of two team-mates and a war
description: In September 1933, Hamburg team-mates Asbjorn Halvorsen and Otto Harder bid each other farewell. They ended up on opposite sides of a concentration camp fence.
